DataElement.preferredName: Random Biopsy Pathology to Imaging Finding Mapping Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not or the likelihood that the pathology report is mappable to the imaging report for a random biopsy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Random Biopsy Pathology To Medical Image Finding Mapping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._The creation of a two-dimensional graphic representation of an area or structure, showing the relative position of features or characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Pathology To Medical Image Finding Mapping
Property.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.:The creation of a two-dimensional graphic representation of an area or structure, showing the relative position of features or characteristics.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
The creation of a two-dimensional graphic representation of an area or structure, showing the relative position of features or characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
